inference:
**Solution:**

For $x \le 3$, we have $f(x) = 9 - 2x$. Therefore,

$$f(f(x)) = f(9 - 2x) = \left\{
\begin{array}{cl}
9 - 2(9 - 2x) & \text{if } 9 - 2x \le 3, \\
a(9 - 2x) + b & \text{if } 9 - 2x > 3.
\end{array}
\right.$$

Since $f(f(x)) = x$ for all $x$, we must have

$$\left\{
\begin{array}{cl}
9 - 2(9 - 2x) = x & \text{if } 9 - 2x \le 3, \\
a(9 - 2x) + b = x & \text{if } 9 - 2x > 3.
\end{array}
\right.$$

Solving the first equation, we get

$$\begin{align*}
9 - 2(9 - 2x) &= x \\
9 - 18 + 4x &= x \\
3x &= 9 \\
x &= 3.
\end{align*}$$

Since $9 - 2x = 3$ when $x = 3$, the first equation is satisfied for $x \le 3$.

Solving the second equation, we get

$$\begin{align*}
a(9 - 2x) + b &= x \\
9a - 2ax + b &= x \\
-2ax + 9a + b - x &= 0 \\
-(2a + 1)x + 9a + b &= 0.
\end{align*}$$

Since this equation must hold for all $x > 3$, we must have

$$-2a - 1 = 0 \quad \Rightarrow \quad a = -\frac{1}{2}$$

and

$$9a + b = 0 \quad \Rightarrow \quad b = -\frac{9}{2}a = -\frac{9}{4}.$$

Therefore,

$$a + b = -\frac{1}{2} + \left(-\frac{9}{4}\right) = \boxed{-\frac{11}{4}}.$$
**Final Answer: \\boxed{$-\frac{11}{4}$}. I hope it is correct.**
ground_truth:
Setting $x = 0,$ we get $f(0) = 9.$ Since $9 > 3,$ $f(9) = 9a + b.$ Hence, $$f(f(0)) = f(9) = 9a + b.$$But $f(f(x)) = x$ for all $x,$ so $9a + b = 0.$

Setting $x = 1,$ we get $f(1) = 7.$ Since $7 > 3,$ $f(7) = 7a + b.$ Hence, $$f(f(1)) = f(7) = 7a + b.$$But $f(f(x)) = x$ for all $x,$ so $7a + b = 1.$

Subtracting the equations $9a + b = 0$ and $7a + b = 1,$ we get $2a = -1,$ so $a = -1/2.$ From $9a + b = 0,$ we get $b = -9a = 9/2.$ Hence, $$a + b = -1/2 + (9/2) = \boxed{4}.$$

ground_truth:
Setting $x = 0,$ we get $f(0) = 9.$ Since $9 > 3,$ $f(9) = 9a + b.$ Hence, $$f(f(0)) = f(9) = 9a + b.$$But $f(f(x)) = x$ for all $x,$ so $9a + b = 0.$

Setting $x = 1,$ we get $f(1) = 7.$ Since $7 > 3,$ $f(7) = 7a + b.$ Hence, $$f(f(1)) = f(7) = 7a + b.$$But $f(f(x)) = x$ for all $x,$ so $7a + b = 1.$

Subtracting the equations $9a + b = 0$ and $7a + b = 1,$ we get $2a = -1,$ so $a = -1/2.$ From $9a + b = 0,$ we get $b = -9a = 9/2.$ Hence, $$a + b = -1/2 + (9/2) = \boxed{4}.$$
